records.location_details: Three underage migrants died of hypothermia approximately 20 km from the Bulgarian-Turkish border, on Bulgarian territory. Alerts were received for Position 1 (42°15'43"N 27°19'56"E), Position 2 (42°17'00"N 27°19'36"E), and Position 3 (42°17'54"N 27°19'37"E). Bodies were found near these positions (22m, 8m, and 4km deviation respectively).

records.context_note: Three underage migrants died of hypothermia near the Bulgarian-Turkish border after crossing from Türkiye. NGOs alerted Bulgarian emergency services multiple times with precise locations, but authorities allegedly failed to react and actively obstructed NGO rescue attempts, leading to significant delays in reaching the migrants. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that Bulgarian authorities failed to assist and rescue migrants, violating the right to life and child protection obligations.
records.evidence_quote: According to a report published by two NGOs, three underage migrants died of hypothermia on 27/12/2024 approximately 20 km from the Bulgarian-Turkish border after they had crossed illegally from Türkiye. Allegedly, the Bulgarian authorities not only did not react to the alerts, but also actively obstructed the NGOs' rescue attempts which resulted in a more than 24-hour delay in reaching the reported positions where the migrants' bodies were found.
